alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 4:55AM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near Juliette affecting Jones County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Alabama... Chattahoochee River at 14th Street at Columbus affecting Chattahoochee, Russell, Muscogee and Lee Counties. Yellowjacket Creek at Hammett Rd below Hogansville affecting Troup County. Tobesofkee Creek near Macon affecting Bibb County. Towaliga River at GA 83 near Juliette affecting Monroe County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Georgia... New River at GA 100 near Corinth affecting Heard County. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Helen, Dahlonega, Cornelia, Buford, Buford, Suwanee, Suwanee, Chattahoochee River upstream McGinnis Ferry Rd, Norcross, Roswell, Chattahoochee River above Roswell, Powers Ferry & I285 Atlanta, Smyrna, Chattahoochee River below Morgan Falls Dam, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Fairburn, Whitesburg, Fairplay, Whitesburg, Whitesburg, Franklin, Corinth, Hammett Rd below Hogansville, Franklin, West Point, Columbus, Union, Omaha...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Towaliga River at GA 83 near Juliette. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Minor flooding expands into woodlands and fields upstream and downstream from the gage on Monticello Highway or Georgia Highway 83. Portions of Byars Road and numerous private access roads near the river will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 19.5 feet and steady. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
